concise_definition: v. 询问, 要求, 邀请 (ask 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: To put a question to someone in order to obtain information, clarification, or an opinion.
definitions.explanation_cn: 向某人提出问题，以获取信息、澄清或意见。
definitions.example_en: She asked him where he had been last night.

definitions.explanation_en: To request or petition someone for something, often politely or formally.
definitions.explanation_cn: 向某人请求或恳求某物，通常带有礼貌或正式的语气。
definitions.example_en: He asked his boss for a day off.

definitions.explanation_en: To invite or extend an offer to someone, especially in social or romantic contexts.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在社交或浪漫语境中邀请某人或发出邀请。
definitions.example_en: He asked her to the prom last spring.
definitions.example_cn: 去年春天，他邀请她参加毕业舞会。

comparison.analysis: “Inquire” (询问) 比 “ask” 更正式，通常用于寻求详细或官方的信息，常用于书面语或专业场合。而 “asked” 更通用，适用于日常对话，语气更直接、口语化。
“Request” (请求) 强调一种正式或有礼貌的诉求，通常不包含直接提问，而是表达一种需要或愿望。而 “asked” 可以包含提问，也可以包含请求，语义范围更广。
“Question” (质问/提问) 常带有怀疑、审问或挑战的语气，尤其在正式或对抗性语境中使用。而 “asked” 通常是中性或温和的，不隐含质疑。例如：The detective questioned the suspect.（侦探审问嫌疑人） vs. She asked him about his day.（她问他今天过得怎么样）
